author: A_Brickset_user
title: A Miami Vice fire boat!
review: I picked this set up at TRU because I wanted to see what  new parts were in it.  As it turns out, builds a nice little boat.  The style of the boat makes me think of a drug runner's boat instead of a fire fighters boat.  Others have made mention of the flip-down nozzle so I won't beat a dead horse about that.  The front of the hull is a new piece.  It integrates well with the rest of the curved pieces that were introduced last year.  The best and worst part is that the old style 4x4 plate with 4-finger hinge has been replaced by a click-hinge version.  I found that when you try to move the hatch, the stiffness of the hinge causes the 1x4 plate to seperate from the rest of the boat. On a positive note, the hatch snaps flat with out needing anything to prop it up.  I would recommend this as sleak addtion to your Lego harbour.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: An OK little Fire boat
review:
I just got this set last night (May 7, 2004) and it builds a nice little boat, but it has some flaws.

   BOAT:Now lets get to the heart of the set. I hate how you use stickers to add detail to the set, which makes playing with it in the water a pain. Also it has no steering wheel it has been replaced by a new control piece(1x4).It has a little rack to hold the radio and binoculars.The old water cannon has also been replaced by a chainsaw body and nozzle which means you don't get two goblets when taken apart. The click-hing peice which houses the water cannon sometimes makes the 1x4 click-hing peice  sepierate from the rest of the boat. The boat has a drug dealer look to it which I like. 

    MINIFIG: The minifig in this set consist of a new body, black legs, the head from the world city helicopter
and the classic firefighter helmet and  a new lifejacket. The lifjacket is pretty cool but not as good as the oringinal.

   OVERALL: A good set that is a good addition to any lego town or collection. Despite some minerflaws I incourage you to buy it.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great boat
review:
I love the design and the sleekness with the nozzle retracted. The only downside is the quarter steps latching hinge for the nozzle, a classic smooth action piece would be better.

I have two other fire boats and this is my favorite.

author: mrmitch
title: Mid sized boat to help the department from the river or lake.
review: Price is right, like the way the water cannon folds up when needed. Solid design and easy to build, could have used a second fireman. Nice looking set and has remained assembled since I got it. Valued addition to any Fire Dept in your town or city collection.

author: legoguysw
title: One of Worlds City's many good sets
review:
The overall attitude towards World City from what I've heard is that is was bad. Those people obviously haven't seen all the sets.
This set is great. It has a firefighter with a life jacket, and radio. The boat has good hull pieces, and a hose hidden in the front. It doesn't come out very easily, a smooth hinge would have been better that a click hinge, but it is a cool idea anyhow. There are 'wings' on the back with lights, and nice curved pieces each side.
Overall a 4, nothing special, but still a great set, now getting to be pretty old, and more and more a part of Classic Town.

author: clone_commander_trainrex
title: fire fighter to the rescue
review: This is cool.  It has a boat with a big water sprayser.  It also has a firefighter with life vest.  It is a =t no shortage of good pieces with the pre built botton and cool fins.  It also floats.  This set is so cool it is a must have for city fans.
